EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Resource Depot & Smelting Facility at base position (x=-4.5, y=18.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=-4.5, y=18.5) serving as central storage.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-3.0, y=19.0) for iron smelting (recently used to produce additional iron plates).
• Stone Furnace at (x=-4.0, y=21.0) for copper plate production.
• Burner Inserter at (x=0.5, y=21.5).

### Automation Lab & Steam Power System (Integrated System) at base configuration
Consists of:
• Lab at (x=-7.5, y=18.5) dedicated to automation research.
• Electricity Groups at (x=3.5, y=22.5) and (x=-4.5, y=17.5).
• Steam Engines positioned at:
  – (x=-13.5, y=16.5)
  – (x=-14.5, y=13.5)
  – (x=7.5, y=35.5)

• Boiler Module:
  – Boiler at (x=12.0, y=20.5); after a recent refuel cycle its status is now WORKING with connection points at (x=12.5, y=18.5) and (x=12.5, y=22.5).
  – Existing PipeGroup connection linking the Boiler to the Steam Engine located at (x=8.5, y=20.5).

### Copper Cable Factory at position (x=1.5, y=19.5)
Consists of:
• Assembling Machine at (x=1.5, y=19.5) reconfigured for iron gear‑wheel production (current status: NO_POWER with warnings of missing electrical supply and insufficient iron‑plate resources).
• Burner Inserter at (x=1.5, y=17.5).
• Input Chest at (x=2.5, y=17.5).
• Output Chest at (x=1.5, y=21.5).
• Dedicated Copper Buffer Chest at (x=-5.5, y=21.5).
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=0.5, y=17.5).
• Additional Burner Inserters at (x=2.5, y=16.5) and (x=3.5, y=17.5).
• Small Electric Pole at (x=5.5, y=19.5) – note that repeated placement attempts and spacing conflicts have been encountered.

### Copper Extraction System (adjacent to the copper smelting furnace)
Consists of:
• Extraction Burner Inserter with pickup/drop positions around (x≈–3.5, y≈23.5).
• Buffer and Chest arrangements for handling copper ore.

### Extraction Belt Depot at position (x=3.5, y=15.5)

### Belt Connection Target Setup for Copper Extraction
Consists of:

### Remote Fluid Integration System at remote region (approximate center: x=-30, y=40)
Consists of:

### Expanded Smelting Zone
Consists of:
• Stone Furnaces at (x=-20.0, y=22.0), (x=-20.0, y=25.0), and (x=-17.0, y=25.0).
• An intended furnace at (x=-17.0, y=22.0) that was not placed due to a blocking PipeGroup at (x=-17.5, y=21.5).

### New Network Structures
Consists of:
• Long‑distance Transport Belt Network spanning from (x=-3.5, y=10.5) to (x=22.5, y=10.5) (29 belts).
• Copper Ore Transport Line (region x≈8–9, y≈11–15) comprising 6 belts.
• Integrated Auxiliary Transport Network centered at (x≈3, y≈16) with connected Belt Groups (23 belts and 16 belts).
• Short Belt Connector A (approximate location x≈–0.5 to –1.5, y≈20.5) linking adjacent factory sections (2 belts).
• Short Belt Connector B (around x≈–4.5 to –5.5) enhancing local connectivity (2 belts plus additional segments).

### Offshore Pump Water Supply Extension for Base Boiler at position (x=12.0, y=20.5)
Consists of:
• Offshore Pump at (x=-13.5, y=26.5) intended to supply water (status: NOT_CONNECTED; warnings: [“no fluid present in connections”]).
• Offshore Pump at (x=1.5, y=32.5) now connected via a new PipeGroup (status: WORKING).
• Boiler at (x=12.0, y=20.5) serving as the central fluid production unit (currently WORKING after recent refuel actions).

### Auxiliary Boiler–Steam Engine Connection Attempts
Consists of:
• Steam Engine at (x=16.5, y=20.5) with a failed connection attempt (status: NOT_CONNECTED; warnings: [“not connected to power network”, “no input liquid”, “no fluid present in connections”]).
• Steam Engine at (x=21.5, y=19.5) with a failed connection attempt (status: NOT_CONNECTED; similar warnings).
• Multiple recent attempts to reposition and craft additional steam engines have been aborted due to inventory shortages and crafting errors.

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• Steam Engine Crafting & Placement Issues:
 – Verify inventory for available steam engines before attempting repositioning or placement.
 – Ensure that the full set of required sub‑ingredients (notably iron‑gear‑wheels and sufficient iron‑plates) is produced and available before crafting a steam engine.

• Intermediate Component Production:
 – Confirm that the production of iron‑gear‑wheels meets the recipe requirements; insufficient iron‑plate availability in production units can lead to cascading failures in assembling steam engines.

• Electrical Component Placement:
 – Check that target build areas are within allowed placement distances and free from existing overlapping entities.
 – Adjust spacing, orientation, or reference positions when placing items such as solar panels and electric poles.
 – Ensure that the inventory contains the required electrical components before placement.

• Resource Shortages:
 – Maintain adequate resource counts (for example, ensure sufficient coal is harvested prior to refuel operations).

• API Parameter Handling:
 – Use the correct parameter names and types in API calls to avoid issues such as unexpected keyword argument errors.

• Connection and Power Integration:
 – Verify that both source and target connection points are accessible and free of obstructions before attempting to join systems.
 – Confirm that required inventories are met prior to executing connection operations to avoid aborted connection attempts.
